verb.definition: To take someone as a prisoner, or to take something into your possession, especially by force.
verb.example: The soldiers captured the enemy's stronghold.

noun.definition: The act of taking someone as a prisoner, or taking something into your possession, especially by force.
noun.example: The capture of the city was a turning point in the war.

usage_examples: The police were able to capture the suspect after a long chase. [3]
The photographer managed to capture the beauty of the sunset in her picture.
